website_summaries.verdict: A compact freestanding fishing rod that wouldn't look out of place in your home or cabin.
pros: Unique round display takes up very little room in your home
Plenty of room for rods and reels
cons: The clips may be too small to accommodate some larger fishing rods

customer_reviews.title: Great Price - Solid Product - Good Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Nailed it. For this price - any complaints you read are missing the point. Thinner rods will shift around in their holders and reels will knock into each other - but it looks good... works well... is sturdy, water resistant, and stable. Actually seems to have revived my kids interest in going fishing and literally 2 days after putting the rods in and having them displayed in the garage - kids are out fishing. What else matters?
customer_reviews.author: nysepete

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control and customer service
customer_reviews.text: The packaging is fine. The product looks decent. However, when assembled the top rod holder disc spins freely which causes the rods to all angle and tilt. The cause is the threaded insert was not inserted correctly into the middle support. The hole is over-drilled which causes the threaded insert to fall out. It is repairable, but why should I have to fix a new product? Update: I received an entire new unit from the company. It was unexpected as I was expecting replacement parts. Thank you for making the situation right.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S Valenzuela

customer_reviews.title: Wow!!! Fantastic!!
customer_reviews.text: I rarely post a review the same day I receive a product. It's THAT good! was not expecting this to be as high quality as it is. I put it together in less than 2 minutes. It fits the poles beautifully and it's very good and solid high quality wood with a nice finish on it. I was looking for cheaper options but the wall mount ones although cheaper took up more room than I wanted in my garage and this you can put right into a corner if desired out of the way of everything and with 16 available spots I won't outgrow it. I highly recommend this if you have multiple fishing poles. Beautiful product worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: acio

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Have paid twice as much for lower quality before, so im really happy with this one. Looks great and holds the rods, not too much else to say about it, other than I'll be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: Rich W

customer_reviews.title: Typical China quality.  A piece of crap!!
customer_reviews.text: The pressed in low quality pronged nut on the base was pressed in missing the hole that the mounting bolt should screw into. I had to pry out the pronged base nut(which has one prong bent to the side) and hammer it in correctly. Part of the cheap pressed board came out when I pried out the misplaced nut, but I was able to jerry-rig it together. Granted, this was a cheap fish pole storage rack and you get what you pay for!!! We need to all get smarter and quit buying this imported crap. I'm old enough to know better! I just won't screw around buying from Rush Creek Creations again and would recommend they buy AMERICAN!!!!
customer_reviews.author: B. F. Ibsen

customer_reviews.title: 4.5 stars, but I rounded up due to the price.
customer_reviews.text: Solid. Sturdy. Child-like ease of assembly. Definitely won’t hold 16 rods AND reels, but the description only claims to hold 16...rods, so I concede the claim is true. I only have 11, but 3 are larger catfish or surf rod & reel combos. Worth the money and is built well enough that I’ll own it for a while. The only other con is the rubber clasps. They’re a bit cumbersome, as they almost require two hands to pry open, but once you get the clasp separated, it holds the rod securely. For the price, great buy. I’m satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: misterjc

customer_reviews.title: Great buy! Affordable and assembles quick!
customer_reviews.text: Put it together in about 2 minutes flat. Way easy to assemble! Not real wood, it's just laminate but for the money it does all I need it to. Now that I've started buying newer and more expensive rods I'd rather not throw them into a bucket in the garage. And it matches pretty good with my pine basement and my fish mounts. A month later I think that the holes for the poles need to be a little deeper as my cats easily knock them out when they play.
customer_reviews.author: Shelltracks

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, keeps rods from getting damaged
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, just a few things to screw together, by hand -- no tools needed. Works well for most of my rods, but two of the surf rods (the longest at 10 and 11 feet length) were too thick to fit into the holder. Grabbed a couple thick rubber bands. Put one end around one holder thing then over the rod and around the other holder. Works fine even though one went across the reel seat.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart easily
customer_reviews.text: This is a terribly made item. The top is supposed to screw down onto the lower column but was not planed level so threads would not catch. After tinkering, was able to get it to hold barely. Had to take apart and super glue it together. I would not buy again. Could have returned it, but had already messed it up by trying to sand the pieces to fit together. My error. And my error in buying this poorly made item.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Page

customer_reviews.title: This rack is just okay.
customer_reviews.text: For the money, it’s not bad. I was a little disappointed. A few low or no cost improvements would add a lot! The little dimples the rod butts go In may be waterproof and should be deeper than 1/64” for stability. Hard to keep rods vertical. My tuna stick is held in place with a rubber band. Rubber clips are too small for many rod handles. More space between rods by having fewer positions or a larger diameter would add to utility and value.
customer_reviews.author: Rip Tide

customer_reviews.title: I wish I could give it negative stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my fiance for Christmas. He just opened it last weekend to put together and the "screws" are too short. It can NOT be put together. Very disappointing considering it is outside of the return window. I never thought to open it sooner considering there could be a defect.
customer_reviews.author: Kari

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: I had a couple wall mounted racks which took up a lot of space and the spacing was such that the large open face reels didn't have enough room. This circular patter works great, takes much less space so I'm very happy and my wife said it was "cute". I'm impressed and very happy with this purchase. Also, it was surprisingly easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Great! Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I have wanted one of these for years but never seemed to get around to buying one. Finally I bought this and I am not disappointed. I finally got all the fishing poles gathered up and in one place. I had no issues with assembly or screws stripping out like some of the other reviewers said. I did get out a hot glue gun and glued all the joints as I assembled them. I am confident this will be sufficient for a long, long service life.
customer_reviews.author: G-man

customer_reviews.title: Basic rod rack that works
customer_reviews.text: It's a good product for the price and it does what it's supposed to do. It requires some assembly, no tools are required and it's very easy to put together. The base and the top are laminated wood, but but for $20 you get what you pay for. So far, it holds my rods from a ultra light 4'8ft to an 7ft fishing rod. It would be nice if the base could swivel but you need to pay a little extra for that. It's a basic rod rack that works. I bough 2 more one for me and one for my son.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. who

customer_reviews.title: Great organization
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect purchase to organize our fishing gear. My kids were continually making a mess of our gear to get their poles out, then replacing them in a jumble. This organizer went together quickly and works well. It's sturdy enough for what I'm using it for, as long as I check it for tightness every once in a while. For the price, I'm not sure I could have organized our poles any cheaper or easier.
customer_reviews.author: Shane B.

customer_reviews.title: Tried twice and really disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: First order, the top screw would not screw in tightly so the top shelf would just spin and it pulled off. Not sturdy at all. Sent that one back to try another one since this is what I was really looking for, however, same thing. That top screw did not screw all the way in to hold the top steady. The top would spin and the top would just pull off. Returned that one as well. I'm looking for something else or either will just have to make my own.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat rickety, rod spacing too close together
customer_reviews.text: Overall, does the job and doesn't take up much space. Once assembled it is somewhat rickety and the top spins pretty freely when you take rods in/out. This isn't a huge deal but it isn't as sturdy as I was hoping. You just have to twist it back whenever you take rods in/out. The spacing on the rod slots is very close together. I find that I cannot find multiple rods/reels of the same size (spinning) next to one another. I can get 16 in there but only if I stagger various sized rod/reel combos so that the reels are higher/lower from slot to slot. Overall, would purchase again though.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M.

customer_reviews.title: Did not live up to my expectations
customer_reviews.text: First, there is no way the rack will hold as many rods as advertised unless you amount the reels. Second, I ordered the "barn siding" color and got the tan one. Third, in order to keep the top "shelf" and base from moving, it must be permanently glued. The secret bolsters do not hold the unit together adequately. On a positive note, it was nice that the top shelf flanges were pre-attached.
customer_reviews.author: fullmoonoutfittersllc

customer_reviews.title: Very tiny didn’t fit on my 6’ rod.
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited when this item came to my door I immediately opened and installed it less than a minute. Very easy. But then when I tried to place my 6’ rod on this rack, it didn’t even fit lol. Photos are deceiving. I wish they allow me to post a phot I took with my 6’ rod! These rack are built for tiny skinny rod. And it’s not even stable. Very disappointed I’m going to return this rack and build my own rod rack.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Storage for rods
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how long this will last in the garage but it got all those rods out of the corner. The amount of money sitting in the corner all leaning up against the wall was outrageous. Now they are able to sit upright and not be ruined. Hoping it will last longer than it looks like it will. It was VERY simple to put together and it just sits in the floor so no installation.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Be sure to check rod length.
customer_reviews.text: I had to return it because it wasn’t tall enough for many of my rods due to their thickness above the foam handle. If I had paid attention in the first place, I would have ordered the rod/reel holder with the extension piece.
customer_reviews.author: Ron S.

customer_reviews.title: Great storage for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: We love this rack! We were storing on hooks before and this looks so much nicer! You will need to put it off in a corner by itself because it isn’t very sturdy. I have a very large dog and he was sleeping next to it and rolled into it, causing the top to twist when his body moved the poles. It was easily tightened back and reorganized, but I was surprised it was so easily manipulated. Otherwise, like I said, we love it!
customer_reviews.author: Donna H

customer_reviews.title: Top thread stripped out of fake wood and now wont hold rods.  Look for something better.
customer_reviews.text: Has threaded inert on the top that requires an interference fit to stay put. The hole was too big, it stripped out. To top spins, all the rods fall out. Not exactly a good quality for rod storage. I am having a hard time reconciling my experience with the 4+ star rating. How many positive reviews can you buy?
customer_reviews.author: Chris Hoogenboom

customer_reviews.title: What a nice rack for rods and reels
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this night before last night and I have already received it and it has already been assembled in less than 5 minutes. The price on this was remarkedly low but it really looks nice and it is gong to organize my fishing equipment and make the area they are in very neat.
customer_reviews.author: Rileybowler

customer_reviews.title: Arrived damaged
customer_reviews.text: Arrived damaged....ALL parts are damaged. No replacement available, returning for refund. Also both discs are not made of wood. They are covered in a cheap laminate. I would not recommend this product. Go with something that will not get ruined with water over time and that is constructed better.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan lappin

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. Don't waste your money on this. Unfortunately I was past return window and couldn't return it. Doesn't securely hold rods if they're thicker or thinner then the norm. The rubber grommets get stretched out if you force a thicker fishing pole in, rendering it useless.
customer_reviews.author: Askiy

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent.
customer_reviews.text: This was a much needed purchase due to the fact that I REALLY needed a way to organize my fishing rods. So simple to assemble and surprisingly really sturdy. I move this thing around by the handle in the center all the time and it's still held together fine. If you can tell from the pictures I can easily fill in the rest of the holding spots with little struggle, just a matter of spinning the rods/reels around to fit accordingly. Will definitely be buying more once I fill this one up.
customer_reviews.author: The Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your $$$
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to put together. It is compact and rods with reels fit side by side ok. I am not pleased with it simply because the rubber rod holders at the top do not hold the rods in well. They are too wide and rods continue to fall out. I would not consider buying this again nor recommend it to anyone. I am building my own rod holder and throwing this rod holder in the trash before one of my rods falls and breaks!
customer_reviews.author: Bram Ballam

customer_reviews.title: Good quality with a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: This is my first fishing rod rack. It literally took me 2 minutes to open the box and assemble this rack. The rack is steady enough for my needs. As shown in pictures, I placed rods with freshwater baitcasting reels with one blank between them so that rods would not hit each other when I will take them to fishing. My freshwater spinning rods and reels fit next to each other, but saltwater gears mostly need some space. Mine is a Wood Grain Laminate design, and it was $19.99 + tax. Cannot beat this price. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: JPB

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.text: After few months of use the rod holder is trash. The rod clips became loose and don’t hold my rods! Contacted amazon, there’s nothing they can do since it’s been out of the 30 day return time. Maybe if you need a holder just to store your poles without taking them out, it might be for you. I use my poles every weekend, it’s basically trash after few months. Purchase something else do not buy this! I would give 0 star if I could. I honestly don’t know where the reviews came from, I purchased this based on the good reviews. Just spend your money somewhere else!
customer_reviews.author: Yuliya Ivanov

customer_reviews.title: Great looking, wooden, very neat
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble, just screw in. Holds 16 rods, probably more comfortable around 8 depending on rod size. It won’t hold some really large ocean rods. Very neat looking. Seems sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Convenient budget rod/reel holder
customer_reviews.text: Had to figure out why, the next day, all my poles where leaning or popped out of the holder. Make sure you double check the tightness before putting in poles. Maybe use wood clue if you don't intend to dismantle. Other than that it works well. I can't put my bigger reels/rods in sure to spacing, but it holds a majority of them.
customer_reviews.author: Lil Bit

customer_reviews.title: Clear Up Space While Showcasing your Rods
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for my boyfriend who is an avid fisherman. I was a little frustrated with the random placement of fishing rods around the apartment and this worked like a charm. The finish on the wood was beautiful and the overall product is amazing. I highly recommend this product! You will not be disappointed. The size of this product is perfect. Holds a lot of rods, was worried about the sturdiness but me being the clumsy person I am have bumped into it on numerous occasions and it has yet to topple over. 5 out of 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking
customer_reviews.text: Only issue I have with this is that if you are using longer rods with foam or rubber forearms, they will not fit in the rod clips so I had to use very small bungie cords and hook the fishing pole and center column on the rod holder frame with the cord.
customer_reviews.author: Rocketman

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: Nice for storing rods in the garage. Takes up little space and you can store rods with reels still attached. Moving it around is fine, except the top portion may turn and you will have to turn it back to align the guides. Holds light and heavy rods just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Orleans1971

customer_reviews.title: It works but isn't very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I would not call this a well-made fishing rod holder. It screwed together in four pieces. It will have to be tightened up over time. The wood is not very thick. It will work but I wish they made things better without having to paying a ton for it.
customer_reviews.author: Tarra

customer_reviews.title: Look for a better quality elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: It looks ok I guess. The quality isn’t there though. It’s not sturdy and even when you tighten the center rod and knob it still a little flimsy. I hand tightened it and started to strip. Good for rod storage if you never touch your rods. I’ll be looking for a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: The top part is not far up enough so the rubber "catchers" end up still onto the rod handle. Then the rubber things are so flimsy that even if they did catch the rods at the right place with the slightest shake or a tilt the rods would fly off this. It is really a plastic laminate piece of junk
customer_reviews.author: NikA

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husband to organize his fishing poles. We have it sitting in the front porch, it has been in some weather and still is holding up good. Great buy and looks really nice once put together. If you have a man that won’t put his poles up, this is a good buy they can easily do this and grab out. It looks nice too!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney perry

customer_reviews.title: disapointed
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice, falls over easily, top piece spins around easily so rods tilt, the plastic clips on the top piece that hold the rods in place suck, if you open them too far they are done and never hold the rod in place again.
customer_reviews.author: tony

customer_reviews.title: Gift for my partner
customer_reviews.text: My partner created a man cave in the second shower space we had. He had his stuff everywhere and I wanted to organize all his fishing stuff. This rack was perfect. He has fishing poles used for salt lake fishing and they all fit. I’m happy it looks nicer and he’s happy he can display it. Assembling was easy and I would recommend it. It doesn’t take up much space either.
customer_reviews.author: b0

customer_reviews.title: Great way to store fishing poles
customer_reviews.text: Was sick of tripping over my husbands fishing poles, getting caught in fishing line and poles getting intertwined. This was a great way to organize them. My husband was happy and so am I. Easy to move all his poles around the garage without getting everything tangled. Easy to set up .
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Wathen

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: I am pretty happy with this fishing pole holder. My last holder deteriorated due to being out in the weather. This one seems like the material is better protected. The bottom slots are shallow indentions. The rods turn and the reels get jumbled.
customer_reviews.author: carter

customer_reviews.title: Awful awful awful
customer_reviews.text: This thing is TRASH. Extra flimsy and constantly walk in garage and several of my rod combos will be on the floor due to this POS flimsy rubber clamps failing. I missed return window so I am throwing in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel

customer_reviews.title: Great light tackle pole holder.
customer_reviews.text: For light, and some medium poles, this is a decent way to organize your gear. Although for heavier tackle, this holder lacks the sturdiness to keep from turning on itself. Also, the rubber clasps will not hold thicker or heavier poles.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Hooker

customer_reviews.title: My son loves this, took forever to come.
customer_reviews.text: My son, 15 years old, put this together in no time and filled it up with his poles. He loves it. He has it in the corner of his room. It's perfect to keep poles organized. It took about a month to arrive.
customer_reviews.author: MrsPicky

customer_reviews.title: Check rods sizes first.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a solid purchase if you only have light gear rods. None of my heavier rods fit but I have 12 rods set on it and it holds up perfectly. Can’t go wrong for light tackle rods.
customer_reviews.author: Geo Arbelo

customer_reviews.title: Good price
customer_reviews.text: The clips that hold the rods do not work well with larger diameter rods. They work great with smaller rods.
customer_reviews.author: Robert P Chapin

customer_reviews.title: Nice rod rack, great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I expected, a nice wooden rack for the rods. Looks well built, especially considering the price, and it seems like it will last for a while. The rods go in and out rater easily and the rack is heavy enough not to have to be stabilized when putting a rod in. Solid buy, hope it stays sturdy in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Edin

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price.  Would purchase again but not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: It seems to come loose and has to be tightened often especially if moved. I wish the divets at the bottom were a bit deeper to hold the rods in place. I move it from our shed to our pond for fishing with the grandkids.
customer_reviews.author: G. Ewert

customer_reviews.title: ... fishing storage rack and I have to say I'm pretty happy with it
customer_reviews.text: This is my first fishing storage rack and I have to say I'm pretty happy with it. It was very easy to put together and the finish on it looks great. I was overjoyed when I finally put my fishing poles in it. It looks good enough that my wife said I could keep it in the bedroom! I only gave it 4 stars because it doesn't spin, which would have been nice, but that's minimal. It is a great product and I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Received faulty piece
customer_reviews.text: The pieces wouldn't screw together properly. It was a faulty piece i received. Instead of screwing in and being sturdy, it would continually spin. I returned and got a refund no issues.
customer_reviews.author: CAT

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: If you want a rod and reel holder for a decent price this is it. Very easy to set up and holds my 12 rod and reels very good. I can fit more but I like to leave a little space between.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Lester

customer_reviews.title: Worked for couple month then cracked
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality product. Worked for couple of months then the pole connecting to the base cracked and would not stay in place. I tried secure the rack with glue and duct tape, and it only worked temporarily. Junk. Stay away.
customer_reviews.author: SP

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of having my fishing poles in five gallon bucket so I ordered this holder. It's a good value, was easy to assemble, looks good, and does the job well. Just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good rod holder at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Despite being laminated disc's, this rod stand works well, and looks pretty good too. No complaints. I have some surf rods that won't fit, but then, they were not designed for large rods, although salmon rods do fit. Very nice product and I'd certainly buy again and recommend to fellow fishermen. Assembled quickly without tools, and is quite sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Beall

customer_reviews.title: Just as advertised
customer_reviews.text: It took all of one minute and a half to fully assemble this product. Completely pleased with all components. I feel sure i could have found something better for another 100.00. But this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: James H. Kahr

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I liked it but too big as full for how little space I have. Cut it in half and drilled it to my garage wall. Still awesome as ever just half of it lol. Plus I won’t ever own more than 8 rods I’m sure.
customer_reviews.author: Andy McMahon

customer_reviews.title: Great for our need.
customer_reviews.text: Needed something to organize the kids fishing poles. This does the trick. It tucks I go a corner easily and though not super sturdy, it has not tilted one bit. Does what we needed it to.
customer_reviews.author: Toni

customer_reviews.title: Nice rack!
customer_reviews.text: Got this to hold my fishing rods. Took a whopping two minutes to assemble and load my poles on. Can I really ask for more? This is a great rack and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: RayJayTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: i have several fishing rods that are lying around. this holder gives them a home to rest. even though it has 16 holders, but i double it can fit that many if all the rod has reels on. but it is plenty enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Great fishing pole stand
customer_reviews.text: This is an inexpensive fishing pole holder, but it does its job! It looks nice and is very sturdy. It holds a lot of fishing poles. I highly recommend getting one of these!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Loctite between the joints for sturdiness.
customer_reviews.text: The thing is nice but when you start to place the rods the thing twistes because is so slippery between the joints, all you have to do is add some loctite glue between the joints and problem solved. Overall it is a good rod holder.
customer_reviews.author: The Truth

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for larger saltwater poles
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent unit for holding average poles. I had to return it because about a 1/3 of my poles are larger salt water poles and the holders don't hold the larger diameter poles.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Too small to fit saltwater fishing rods
customer_reviews.text: The rubber clippers on the top panel are too small. They can only hold thin fishing rods. I got a saltwater fishing rod and it's too small to fit it the rod in :(
customer_reviews.author: Oldhappykid

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Our mudroom is small and we needed the fishing rods to go vertical. This was fast and easy to assemble. It doesn't quite grip every rod and you'll need to space out the rods, but otherwise it is very functional. A good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: sturdy and nice product, but for smaller poles.
customer_reviews.text: Good things: Easy to put together. beautiful looking stand. Does not fall over even with the maximum of 16 poles in it. Does not take up too much space. Sturdy. Drawbacks: Does not hold large rods used for saltwater. The clips are too small to fit around the large pole.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Jeffers

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: It holds all of my regular fishing rods in one place. The heavy surf casting rod is too tall to fit inside the house floor to ceiling anyways, so no big deal.
customer_reviews.author: L. M.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My husband owns a lot of fishing poles and we needed a place to store them without damaging them. I am very pleased with this product. It holds the fishing poles very nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Husband Loved it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my husband for Christmas. He loves it. He has already filled it up with his fishing poles. Great purchase and easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Diet Pepsi Girl

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Have been looking around for a while for a nice one, was worried this might be chincy. It is well made looks great, looks like it belongs in a nice bait shop, would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I was completely shocked when it arrived and how it was so easy to assemble. After first glance after assembling , I thought that it would not be that sturdy but I have 12 poles currently in place and its solid as a rock !!!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the fishing rods!
customer_reviews.text: Had this product for about eight months and it’s worked perfectly to hold up all of my husbands fishing rods. I would highly Recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Ginger Pritchett

customer_reviews.title: 🤬🤬🤬
customer_reviews.text: The style was wonderful but the quality of it is VERY poor... Top didn't get tight before the bolt stripped... Sorely disappointed... All I ended up with was a 30 dollar lose... 🤬
customer_reviews.author: Brian Rhoads

customer_reviews.title: Bought as a gift
customer_reviews.text: My friend's husband has a mess of fishing poles leaned up against the wall normally. This is the perfect solition to organize them and make them easy to move around.
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and fairly sturdy. I wish that the rod holder portion was a little stronger to hold rods with a thicker diameter, but all in all, it's a good storage rack.
customer_reviews.author: Ron and Carol

customer_reviews.title: Arrived exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: This is not the fanciest or the prettiest. They actually do have other options that cost more. It does what I wanted it to do. Therefore it gets 5 stars... I'd buy another one when I get my collection up.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff eshlenma

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this rod holder and came in super quick, it was really easy to put together, and holds rods nicely. I would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Saul

customer_reviews.title: Functional
customer_reviews.text: This is a really cool way to store/display our fishing poles at the cabin. The only con is that it’s a little wobbly when pulling the pole off.
customer_reviews.author: Alissa

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: Great, economical way to store your rods. I purchased the wood grain design and it looks great. It's sturdy and assembles in about 1 minute with no tools needed. The rubber clips work perfectly and all of my rods fit securely. For the money, I don't think there is a better way to organize and secure your rods.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua B.

customer_reviews.title: The storage rack won't stay tight and the top rotates skewing the fishing poles
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be a decent purchase but it is almost impossible to get the top portion from rotating. The assembly is quite easy as everything screws together. When the top portion rotates, all the fishing poles (which were vertical) lean over. I guess I'm going to have to epoxy the darned thing.
customer_reviews.author: Nieds

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Stylish
customer_reviews.text: Ideal rod holder and is sturdy and easy to assemble. Looks great with all my rods and is spacious enough to store both baitcasters and spinning reels.
customer_reviews.author: THOMAS SCOTT

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice. Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Should hold a decent amount of fishing rods, except the rubber loops can’t be trusted to hold the rods in place.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Mathews

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this unit is a great buy. It holds my rods securely and keeps them neat and out of the way. It works for rods of various sizes, and assembly took all of twenty seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Jim R

customer_reviews.title: Rush Creek Creations 16 Rod Holder
customer_reviews.text: The product was super easy to assemble. It is also very sturdy. We put about 10 rods on it from the start and it holds everything from fly rods to spin casting rods. I can't imagine a rod it would not hold. Can't speak to durability but it seems very well made and it should last for quite a while. While this is the "budget" model, the appearance is very nice and goes well with the decor of our cabin.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Works great and looks nice, too
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together and nice looking. Looks like furniture. I keep mine in the garage so its looks don't matter much to me.
customer_reviews.author: kcurran

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: It works great, looks great, and it should last a long time if you can keep it in a cool, dry place. It's cheap particle board with laminate. Not friendly with rain or sun. But I'm very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Groupon rulz

customer_reviews.title: Won’t accommodate salt water rods
customer_reviews.text: This is too small for the salt water rods I fish. The rods have beautiful foam grips which are taller than the rod holder so the rods won’t snap into place. Looks to be a good setup if you’re fishing smaller diameter rods for fresh water. I have it four stars as it’s probably nice enough for its intended purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: My husband had been wanting a fishing rod holder forever. This product was so easy to put together and has fixed all our needs.
customer_reviews.author: Jen Christie

customer_reviews.title: This is one of  the best thing I have ever ordered on line.
customer_reviews.text: Any one who fishes at all, must have one of these. It doesn't matter how many rods you have, I can save you time when you get ready to go fishing. My rods use to stay in the back of my truck but no more. They are in my shop dry and ready to fish. No more tangled lines due to laying them around. I would buy this product Ronald Lewis South Hill, Virginia
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Freshwater only
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT for saltwater reals. We made it work with zip ties. The product itself is good but again not for big Tod's and reels.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to set up. No issues with tightening. Seems a bit cheaper in quality than I expected. Does the job so far.
customer_reviews.author: Bmr16

customer_reviews.title: Good for $20 but probably wouldn't pay more than that
customer_reviews.text: It's good for what it is but definitely not as sturdy as I thought it would be. The wood isn't what I thought it would be either. There are some imperfections in the product as seen in the photo provided.
customer_reviews.author: Khou Lor

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Great buy! Keeps all the families fishing poles in a good place and really encourages kids to store their fishing poles properly!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed - Poor craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: The threaded inserts on one of the posts is loose and will not tighten down. Given the popularity of the product I figured I was safe but I've definitely received a dud. I'm sending this back.
customer_reviews.author: Big Don

customer_reviews.title: Super easy assembly...Looks and works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the 16 rod rotating carousel in the plain for $20. Got way more than I expected. Quality construction in an affordable package. Might have tried the barnwood if I wasn't spending on the cheap. Highly recommend. Organizes and protects your rods. The whole thing is very portable so you can move out of your way if you don't have a permanent parking spot.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Bardin

customer_reviews.title: One major flaw.
customer_reviews.text: The top piece which keeps the top circular piece in strip easily. This causes the stand to be less sturdy, since it moves. Other than that it's okay.
customer_reviews.author: M&A

customer_reviews.title: Small rods
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my small rods. I put a polyurethane coat on it just to protect it from humidity, since it’s in my she-shed. 😂
customer_reviews.author: Florida lady

customer_reviews.title: Great for price and ease of assembly
customer_reviews.text: No issues with installation. Most of my rods fit just fine. Big improvement from resting in corner and getting banged up.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Very nice.  Easy assembly and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised how small the package is when shipped. It goes together in about a minute and is a nice size. Really can't beat it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hutchin

product_meta.title: Rush Creek Creations Round 16 Fishing Rod Storage Rack
feature_bullets: UNIQUE FISHING ROD STORAGE: Round fishing pole rack stores and displays up to 16 rod and reel combos (rods not included)
HANDCRAFTED WOOD POST: Durable wood grain laminate makes for a traditional looking rod rack to blend in seamlessly with your décor
EASY ACCESSIBILITY: Includes a solid 2-piece wood center post at the perfect height for your rods
VERSATILE SLOTS AND ROD CLIPS: Includes padded slots on base plate for rod handles plus soft rod clips that adjust to any rod taper
OFFICIAL RACK SIZE: Measures 13.3 inches L x 13.3 inches W x 30 inches H - No tools required for assembly

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
